conscious way energy infrastructure companies have also been focused on improving their environmental profile with a number of names announcing explicit targets for reducing emissions companies in the midstream sector are starting to turn to automation for a centralized workflow the use of technology makes way for improved efficiency and security in the management of midstream operations it is also an economical option with a potential for increased profitability by reducing costs and increasing operational efficiencies the midstream sector which bridges the gap between production and product distribution plays a role in keeping the oil and gas industry afloat and satisfying consumer demands for this reason midstream companies constantly look for innovative technologies that streamline their processes — and this is where automation enters the picture while assets such as compressors trucks underground pipes and tanks have been heavily funded by the midstream sector there has been a lack of interest to invest shown by this sector towards automation and providing the technology and support these assets require this in turn has led to several downsides which include lack of improvement in the midstream sector which has caused lack of motivation for employees who despite being overworked see no improvements moreover the companies face high administrative charges due to lack of automation companies that are lagging behind on digital maturity face major threats the high cost and low efficiency of manpower lack of enough skilled personnel and more importantly the high pressure from investors while technology is at the forefront of most industrial sectors today the oil and gas sector is yet to reach the same level of digital maturity in comparison to other sectors oil and gas is at last 468 place when it comes to digital maturity and it is no surprise that companies are losing their value and money the level of automation in oil and gas is a mere 1 3 which is the lowest for any industry on the other hand sectors such as insurance has a level of automation of 2 2 which is close to twice the level of automation it is not to say that the whole sector is lagging in technology at the core of the industry technologies such as horizontal drilling and hydraulic fracturing are highly advanced and efficient some modern technologies in the industry aid in reducing carbon emissions thus proving to be sustainable however the area where the sector is lagging is the logistics and work management it is not the fact that these technologies do not exist but rather the lack of willingness to invest in them by the leaders of the companies the midstream sector is the backbone for storing and transporting oil and gas from source to destination and can only be technologically improved based analysis of gas signify phase of hydrocarbons in formation although it is widely utilized the informativity of gas logging is significantly limited by technical and environmental conditions the gas inflows in the borehole at total depth and dissimilates in mud that fills the borehole after that the concentration of gas is being registered in liquid elevated to the surface via circulation this preconditions difficulty of tying the data of gas logging diagrams to true depth that generate this inflow more than that the gas flow is dependent on many different factors among which the temperature and pressure conditions the physical and chemical properties of gas that depend on its composition the properties of drilling mud the geological factors – the presence of abnormal pore pressure zones as well as drilling parameters and liquid circulation speed the impact of such vast bunch of different factors some of them dependent on the depth to make matters worse is an obstacle in way of creating the reliable methodology of solving geological problems in quantitative way using gas logging data contemporarily mud logging practices attract more and more attention from petroleum companies the ways to replace expensive borehole logging surveys by relatively cheap mud logging are being investigated especially in the light of increasing informativity of the latter in this work we make an attempt to find additional informativity of gas logging and define possible geological problems that may become solved with it at a regular basis in the future in the course of researching this case we have derived several mathematical models of gas flow in the drilled borehole and have solved forward problem – the modelling of synthetical curves of gas logs as functions of petrophysical properties of rocks gas saturation and drilling conditions factors that also were taken in consideration were multicomponent gas composition its natural speed of floating up in the liquid different lithology of 477 formations synthetical curves were compared to real wells ’ natural curves by means of mathematical analysis also some investigation on correlation between gas logging and geophysical parameters as well as core properties has been conveyed as a result of work most valid and realistic models are defined perspective trails for onward research in this field are highlighted references automated if leaders are willing to set aspirational goals that benefit not only themselves but also the consumers and providers some technological innovations may include the optimization of logistics using a software or platform where pricing scheduling dispatch and payments are being organized by the platform instead of hiring personnel this reduces errors and also plays an important role in connecting everyone involved in the chain from producers to consumers in addition automation allows for more efficient and smart tools that allow to increase productivity and improve sales automation provides high levels of safety and better operations in oil refineries which in turn allows them to meet their specific goals without depending on manpower and being more efficient in that way what most leaders do not understand is that automation saves them money rather than taking money out of their pockets it is an investment rather than an expense ai allows for faster and more accurate work while still reducing the cost of manual labor tasks usually done manually such as pipe handling during drilling can be automated to cut back on time and reduce risk of injury many other tasks otherwise done manually can be handled by ai and digital technologies in order to improve efficiency save cost and time so this begs the question again is technology the way forward or are we still going to rely on manual labor that is time consuming leads to fatigue and does not have precision anywhere near that of ai all indications are to suggest that digital technology is the solution to the backwardness of the midstream sector of oil and gas we must turn to ai to help us build infrastructure and innovate the oil and gas sector in in order to be able to cope with the growing global demand for oil and gas while still managing to keep a lid on global warming references 1 digitalization is transforming the midstream oil and gas sector in asia federation and the kingdom of norway in the energy sector in the arctic region especially in the oil and gas industry the purpose of the work is to analyze the international legal basis for cooperation between states in the field of oil and gas production in the arctic to highlight in particular the key provisions of the treaty between the russian federation and the kingdom of norway on the delimitation of maritime spaces and cooperation in the barents sea and the arctic ocean to highlight aspects of the development of the region according to the arctic policies of russia and norway as well as the prospects for the implementation of joint projects in the arctic keywords international law cooperation in the arctic norway russia the basic agreement in the field of cooperation between norway and russia in the arctic region is the agreement on the delimitation of maritime spaces and cooperation in the barents sea and the arctic ocean of september 15 2010 the purpose of the agreement was to complete the territorial disputes of states in the barents sea developing international cooperation achieving the most efficient use of hydrocarbons in the arctic and rational management of resources in the barents sea and the arctic ocean according to the new border 80 thousand km of the continental shelf formerly belonging to russia was recognized as norwegian territory this treaty received a mixed assessment from experts since russia inter alia lost key fishing areas for fishing undoubtedly the agreement does not correspond to the interests of the russian federation in the arctic region and is an ambiguous political decision but it serves as the basis for establishing cooperation between states in the field of oil and gas production on the continental shelf in the arctic using norwegian and russian new technologies that meet environmental safety requirements it is necessary to pay attention to the policies and strategies adopted by states regarding to the development of the arctic region according to the report of the norwegian government product of production is another source of electricity generation which allows to engage in a fairly profitable business since it is pumped into gas turbine and gas piston installations that are capable of generating free energy which makes it 460 useful to dispose of excess gas through mining this activity allows enterprises not only to accumulate cryptocurrency themselves by investing in the future but also to attract investors who are ready to place mining capacities at their enterprises for example gazprom installed a mobile container designed for mining and connected it to electricity from associated petroleum gas which allowed the use of raw materials in an area with unprofitable transportation since the decree of the government of the russian federation of january 8 2009 established that the amount of burned associated gas should reach no more than five percent of the extracted associated gas this method of using this gas allows it to be used rationally nevertheless mining and cryptocurrencies in general are still not fully detailed in the law « on digital financial assets » which leads this activity into a gray zone that is devoid of legal regulation analyzing the above provisions it can be assumed that russian legislation is already close to the legal regulation of mining as a method of obtaining cryptocurrencies it is important at the legislative level to consolidate the ability of fuel and energy companies to attract investors who will benefit both for themselves and for the development of the enterprises themselves in addition it is necessary to grant the right to companies to use deposits and their enterprises for the purpose of mining it is also impossible to ignore the quantitative limits of the usage of associated petroleum gas increasing the existing rate of 5 percent this in turn will allow us to develop a system of more environmentally friendly disposal of unnecessary gas during production as well as the proceeds will be used to develop the latest technologies for the fuel and energy complex and the flourishing of the country gaisin m t abstract the international climate agenda as well as the new trends in russian legislation oblige industries to reduce greenhouse gas emissions from production processes the main oil transport has a low level of emissions compared to the downstream and upstream sectors but still emissions do not allow achieving the goals set in the 2015 paris agreement the paper describes the main features of greenhouse gas emissions management at oil pipelines as well as substantiates the main measures to reduce emissions keywords greenhouse gas pipeline climate change energy transition carbon management 7 million people suffer from climate change caused diseases annually climate changes cause natural disasters such as inundations forest fires etc industrial accidents as well as aggravation of social and gender inequality climate change resilience and adaptation stay among the main topics of international discussions and require the active involvement of all participants in the world community russia adopted many regulations related to the greenhouse gas emissions during 2020 and 2021 among them is the strategy of the russian federation for low carbon dioxide emissions the strategy includes the low carbon scenario which assumes achieving the carbon neutrality by 2060 this actions on the part of the state show us the relevance of the topic at the sectoral national and international level climate changes may have a negative impact on the oil pipeline industry thawing of permafrost layers causes damage to infrastructure increased precipitation increased risk of forest fires moreover there are the transition period risks that come along with the legislation and market changes for instance the industry could suffer from the introduction of that in most foreign countries there are no large monopolies on the main oil transport often trunk pipelines belong to many private companies and it is impossible to talk about a common pipeline system in which it would be possible to organize a competent mixing of oil flows of different quality therefore if necessary mixing of oils of different grades takes place at special enterprises or directly at refineries the decline in oil prices due to the fall in the market which began in 2014 prompted refineries to purchase cheaper grades of oil and mix them together to obtain a mixture for oil and gas production термодинамический свойство нефтяной композиция abstract study of properties of oil disperse systems gives an opportunity to develop ways of their control for intensification of processes of oil raw materials processing one of possible variants of intensification of processes is compounding of oil raw materials in the process of compounding of oil raw materials there is an impact on kinetics of nucleation and development of a new phase which allows to regulate the ratio of the dispersed phase and dispersion medium in oil emulsions during compounding various physical and chemical interactions occur during which new disperse systems are formed the behavior of oil disperse systems during their processing is significantly affected not only by changes in physical and chemical but also thermodynamic parameters which are primarily related to the nature of the processes occurring on the interface between the dispersed phase and dispersion medium the purpose of this work is to study the influence of the composition of raw materials on the structural and thermodynamic properties of oil compositions ключевой слово компаундирование термодинамический характеристика abstract the research considers the properties of gas hydrates and their structure as well as methods of using hydrates as alternative sources of energy what is more the information on the gas hydrate location is analysed as well as methods of their detection finally the research considers gas hydrate field development based on the world ’ s first offshore field keywords gas hydrate deposits gas hydrates development field wells shelf gas hydrates are an ice mass with a hydrocarbon gas enclosed in it most often methane or it is a mixture of water and methane in certain concentrations capable of forming ice under certain thermobaric conditions gas hydrates belong to the metastable structures gas hydrates are stable if there is a low temperature in the permafrost on land or low temperature and high pressure of the sedimentary column of the deep ocean the zone of gas hydrates stability is known to be established in the open ocean the zone starts from a water depth of 450 meters and under the ocean floor it stands to the level of mentioned plants is carried out through the construction of a shipping complex located at a distance from the shore and connected to the coastal structures by transitional bridges or overpasses the shipping complex has proven itself as a safe and reliable solution for lng shipments however the length of the overpasses can vary from tens to hundreds of meters the construction of such a stationary complex is due to a number of requirements for the terrain and difficulties in the implementation of the project greatly increasing investment an alternative solution for lng shipment is the use of an outrigger berthing facility the main essence of the mathematical model of lng filling outriggers is that this model consists of several parts that allow the calculation of a thermohydraulic mathematical model and describe the calculation of hydraulics and the operation of outriggers the simulation results showed the possibility of using cryogenic outrigger structures for lng filling as well as the selection of a number of conditions necessary for the operation of these structures references regarding the industrial safety and development of offshore fields located in harsh climate conditions all based on the use of modern technologies such as cameras and sensors to clear the way and secure the work on the platform the idea of using unmanned aerial vehicles in offshore oil and gas facilities is proposed the idea is based on the use of modern technologies in the field of unmanned vehicles this will facilitate and secure the work of personnel on the platform keywords offshore oil and gas facilities unmanned aerial vehicles safety harsh climate the development of oil and gas resources by offshore facilities involves significant costs and a high level of risk the main difficulty faced by companies in the harsh climatic conditions severe frosts almost all year round prolonged polar night the threat of damage to offshore drilling rigs by arctic ice swampy tundra have an extremely negative impact on personnel and equipment unmanned aerial vehicles can be used for external inspection of the station sensors model based on the obtained data using machine learning algorithms that can accurately predict pressure at well bore bottomhole pressure is essential knowledge for petroleum engineers its accurate determination makes well tests and reservoir diagnostics more effective the model discussed in this paper may enable engineers to avoid installing downhole gauges thus reducing overall well cost data gathered from different wells in the same field were used for that purpose the model was trained on more than 10000 observed results one output parameter and more than 10 input parameters were selected all these data were divided into a training sample and a test sample by comparing different metrics the best machine learning method was selected which is planned to be tested on other oil
